description: d(n) * phi(n), where d(n) is the number of divisors function.
comments: a(n) = sum of gcd(k-1,n) for 1<=k<=n and gcd(k,n)=1 (Menon's identity).
references: D. M. Burton, Elementary Number Theory, Allyn and Bacon Inc., Boston MA, 1976, Prob. 7.2 12, p. 141.
P. K. Menon, On the sum gcd(a-1,n) [(a,n)=1], J. Indian Math. Soc.(N.S.), 29 (1965), 155-163.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1,...,1000
R. J. Mathar, Survey of Dirichlet series of multiplicative arithmetic functions, arXiv:1106.4038, Section 3.15.
M. Tarnauceanu, A generalization of the Menon's identity, arXiv:1109.2198 [math.GR]
Laszlo Toth, Menon's identity and arithmetical sums representing functions of several variables, Rend. Sem. Mat. Univ. Politec. Torino, 69 (2011), 97-110.
formula: Dirichlet convolution of A047994 and A000010. - _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 15 2011
prog: (PARI) a(n)=numdiv(n)*eulerphi(n); vector(150,n,a(n))(PARI) { for (n=1, 1000, write("b062355.txt", n, " ", numdiv(n)*eulerphi(n)) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Aug 05 2009
author: Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), Jul 06 2001
